intro: Babcockia platylepis var. remotilacinia, commonly known as the remote redshank, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive reddish tinge, especially along the veins. This variety is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
